name: Basic Movement
concept: Learn how Karel moves around the world using basic movement commands
objectives: Master the fundamental movement commands: karel_move() and karel_turn_left(). Understand how Karel navigates in a grid world and how to check if the path is clear.

name: Beeper Operations
concept: Learn how to interact with beepers in Karel's world
objectives: Master beeper pickup and placement commands. Learn to detect beepers and use them to solve problems. Practice conditional logic based on beeper presence.

name: Conditional Logic
concept: Use conditional statements to make Karel respond to different situations
objectives: Learn to use if statements with world sensing functions. Practice combining multiple conditions and creating responsive robot behavior.

name: Loops & Repetition
concept: Use loops to make Karel repeat actions efficiently
objectives: Master while loops and for loops. Learn to create efficient solutions that work for different world configurations. Practice loop design patterns.

name: Problem Solving
concept: Combine all Karel concepts to solve complex challenges
objectives: Apply all learned concepts to solve multi-step problems. Practice breaking down complex tasks into simpler components. Develop algorithmic thinking skills.
